results.title: Endocrine glands
results.brief_description: By means of animation and microphotography, this film demonstrates the nature and function of the parathyroid, the pituitary, and the thyroid glands, and the pancreas. The use of insulin in treating diabetes is demonstrated, hyper and hypothyroidism are discussed, and stimulation of the mammary gland illustrated.

results.title: Endo what?
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Bower Bird Films, Megan McMurchy and Pat Fiske
results.brief_description: Endometriosis is a condition that affects about 15% of women between the onset of puberty and menopause. “Endo” occurs when the lining of the uterus, the endometrium, migrates to locations outside the uterus. This misplaced endometrium is most commonly found on the ovaries, uterus, bowels, bladder, ligaments, and on the Pouch of Douglas. This tissue bleeds every month and causes cysts and adhesions to form, sometimes binding organs together. Endometriosis often remains undiagnosed by doctors - the average length of time before a correct diagnosis is made is eight years. This short film features interviews with women of all ages and backgrounds who relate their experiences with “endo”. This video dispels the myths about endometriosis and offers positive suggestions for coping effectively with this condition.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Bower Bird Films, Megan McMurchy and Pat Fiske

results.title: Endangered animals: survivors on the brink
results.brief_description: Marty (a concerned student) and Rick (a detective) search for an answer to the plight of vanishing wildlife, investigating the causes of extinction. They focus on five endangered animals in an attempt to discover why they are in danger of becoming extinct. The species covered and the identified reasons for being endangered include: African black rhinoceros (illegal animal trade), Orangutans (habitat destruction), Peregrine falcons (pesticides), Manatees (human activity), and American burying beetles (unknown). The video deals with the issue that it is important to find out about the plight of animals and to help if possible - the more people who help restore habitats, raise money and increase awareness, the easier it will be to save endangered species. The goal is to save animals from extinction by finding a balance between human needs and the needs of all animals. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s Guide included.

results.title: Endangered
results.brief_description:
The following endangered species come to life from Australian stamps: Leadbeater’s Possum; Greater Bilby and the Stick Nest Rat. The film ends with a stamp depicting Australian Aboriginal, Truganini.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: End of the old order: 1900-1918
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns International, New York Times Productions, Pat Ferns, Sam Summerlin and Jeremy Murray-Brown
results.brief_description: This film begins with Queen Victoria’s funeral procession in 1901, at which time no one could envisage any threat of war. This film looks at the technological development of Germany, the mass migration to America during the first decade of this century, the seeking of allies by France, the events leading up to World War 1, and the Russian Revolution

results.title: End of the line
results.brief_description: This film was shot in a small industrial village, in North West England, called Heap Bridge. The film examines this village, its main industry being papermaking, and its history that goes back to the Industrial Revolution over 150 years ago.

results.title: End of a summers day
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Pearson, Don Rennick and Robert Fortier
results.brief_description: A comment without words on the ancient theme of love and war: the man called to arms for his country; his sweetheart left behind to mourn; sorrow and separation visited upon the innocent. This is how it has always been, but implicit in the film are the protests of a new generation: Must it always be so? Is not love better than war? Cast includes: Michel Gauthier, Dennis Nadeau, Caroline Price, Paul Sullivan. (Award: New York)

results.title: End game in Paris
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall and Veronika Soul
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a segment of Ian Adam’s novel ‘End Game in Paris’, this film concerns a man’s search for his double. The man, a freelance photographer recently returned from Saigon, discovers that his life is being threatened. Filmmaker Veronika Soul experiments with sound and image to create a tense, enigmatic drama in which the audience is walked along a thin edge. Camera by Wolf Koenig. (Awards: Yorkton)

results.title: End Game
results.creator_credit: Rhys Graham, Emma Crimmings and Michael Fairlie
results.brief_description: Using the fragments, clock leaders and strips of films found at the beginning and end of hundreds of old 16mm films, this Public Imaging work explores the visual beauty of the film’s surface. Concealed among ACMI’s vast film collection, these pieces of film are a testament to the aging wonder of celluloid. The play of light and colour that can be found in the interweaving of these accidents and offcuts makes for a hypnotic experience.
